post_text: Warning signs may appear in conversations, through a personâ€™s actions, or in social media posts. If you observe one or more warning signs, especially if the behavior is new, has increased, or seems related to a painful event, loss or change, reach out. Trust your instincts. Learn the warning signs at suicideispreventable.org

post_text:
LT Book Club is a new club created with the goal of providing an inclusive, supportive environment for students to explore their interest and love for reading. During meetings, students will partake in activities, discuss their books in groups and have conversations in a stress-free environment. Stay tuned for more info about our intro meeting on Thurs, Sept. 10 at 6pm!

Also be sure to check them out on social media: Instagram @lthsbookclub and our page is www.lths.net/bookclub

MR LT - 7:00pm EVERY NIGHT this week! This year's Mr. LT Pageant will air on LTTV's YouTube channel during the week of April 20-24, with the winner crowned LIVE on Friday, April 24. Last year, LT Student Council collected $3,894.14 for the Jack Kunkle Memorial Scholarship Fund. How much will be donated this year?!

The Jack Kunkle Memorial Scholarship Fund was established in 2015 to honor the first Mr. LT's memory and to award Lyons Township High School seniors who have participated in performing arts, including theatre, improvisation, choir, WLTL, and LTTV.

AIR DATES (7:00 P.M. ON YOUTUBE.COM/LTTVONLINE)

Tuesday, April 21 â€“ Opening Dance and Swimsuit Competition

post_text:
The Lyons Township High School Hall of Fame is seeking nominations of graduates and friends of the district who have accomplished great things. If you know someone worthy of induction, downloaded a nomination form: https://www.lths.net/cms/lib/IL01904810/Centricity/ModuleInstance/38642/Hall%20of%20Fame%20Nomination%20Form.pdf. The deadline is March 1.

The Hall of Fame recognizes those who have brought great credit and distinction to the school through their accomplishments or service in the arts, athletics, business, education, public service or other professions. Inductees also provide students with role models who know and share the same traditions of our community and school system. All 65,000 alumni are eligible for induction into the Hall of Fame.
text:
The Lyons Township High School Hall of Fame is seeking nominations of graduates and friends of the district who have accomplished great things. If you know someone worthy of induction, downloaded a nomination form: https://www.lths.net/cms/lib/IL01904810/Centricity/ModuleInstance/38642/Hall%20of%20Fame%20Nomination%20Form.pdf. The deadline is March 1.

The Hall of Fame recognizes those who have brought great credit and distinction to the school through their accomplishments or service in the arts, athletics, business, education, public service or other professions. Inductees also provide students with role models who know and share the same traditions of our community and school system. All 65,000 alumni are eligible for induction into the Hall of Fame.

post_text:
LTHS, the Parent Community Network and the Parent-Teacher Council are proud to host a parenting presentation, entitled Parenting the New Teen in the Age of Anxiety, Thursday, September 19, at 7pm in the North Campus Reber Center. Admission is free.

The presentation will discuss the world our kids are navigating and how it is so radically different than it was even a few years ago. Teens are psychologically and emotionally burdened by social media, unreasonable academic and social stressors, and an unprecedented stream of information. They are exposed to the harshest elements of the world much too soon, as early as 8- or 9-years-old.
text:
LTHS, the Parent Community Network and the Parent-Teacher Council are proud to host a parenting presentation, entitled Parenting the New Teen in the Age of Anxiety, Thursday, September 19, at 7pm in the North Campus Reber Center. Admission is free.

The presentation will discuss the world our kids are navigating and how it is so radically different than it was even a few years ago. Teens are psychologically and emotionally burdened by social media, unreasonable academic and social stressors, and an unprecedented stream of information. They are exposed to the harshest elements of the world much too soon, as early as 8- or 9-years-old.
